metadata.Title: CVE-2023-31248 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - high
metadata.Description:
Linux Kernel nftables Use-After-Free Local Privilege EscalationVulnerability; `nft_chain_lookup_byid()` failed to check whether a chainwas active and CAP_NET_ADMIN is in any user or network namespace

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-31248` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-26-generic - 6.2.0-26.26
linux-image-6.2.0-26-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-26.26
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-26-generic - 6.2.0-26.26
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-26-generic-64k - 6.2.0-26.26
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1009-kvm - 6.2.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1008-aws - 6.2.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1008-azure - 6.2.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1010-gcp - 6.2.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1006-ibm - 6.2.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1009-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1009.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1009-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1008-oracle - 6.2.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1009-raspi - 6.2.0-1009.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-26.26').
linux-kvm package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1009.9').
linux-aws package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1008.8').
linux-azure package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1008.8').
linux-gcp package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1010.10').
linux-ibm package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1006.6').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1009.9').
linux-oracle package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1008.8').
